p:
Splenic B-cell response is disrupted during Plasmodium infection due to germinal center (GC) dysregulation
25– 29 . To determine if disruption in the spleen is the primary reason for the suppression of CHIKV-specific antibodies in Plasmodium and CHIKV co-infected mice (Fig. 4a–f), concurrent PbA + CHIKV co-infection was performed in splenectomised mice. Pre-Py17x co-infection was excluded due to the impact of Plasmodium induced IFNγ at the point of CHIKV infection that suppressed early acute CHIKV viral load (Fig. 3).
